alert.note: Alert for Glacier Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 23 at 5:59AM AKST until January 24 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW AND FREEZING RAIN CONTINUE ACROSS THE NORTHERN PANHANDLE THROUGH TUESDAY... .Snowfall continues across the northern panhandle with some pockets of freezing rain moving north through the daytime and evening on Tuesday as warmer air starts to arrive. Over the inner channels near Juneau, snow has started to become wetter but temperatures have remained cold enough to stay as snow. Precipitation rates will significantly diminish beginning Wednesday morning. ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow and freezing rain. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 7 inches, ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Gustavus, Hoonah, Tenakee Springs, Elfin Cove, and Pelican. * WHEN...Until midnight AKST tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will start to become wetter. Freezing rain may mix in with snow, resulting in significant variability in snowfall totals.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water with you in case of an emergency. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
